sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"秋天"之意。
means: autumn和fall这两个词的区别在于使用地区的不同，前者为英国用词，后者是美国英语。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French autompne, or later directly from Latin autumnus

entry.def: Autumn is the season between summer and winter when the weather becomes cooler and the leaves fall off the trees.

example.ex: We are always plagued by wasps in autumn.
example.tran: 每年秋天，我们这里总是黄蜂成灾。

means.word_mean: 1. the season when the leaves fall from the trees;

auth_sentence.content: It will be shown on BBC One this autumn.
auth_sentence.res_content: It will be shown on BBC One this autumn.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It will be shown on BBC One this autumn.

auth_sentence.content: My phone rang as summer gave way to autumn.
auth_sentence.res_content: My phone rang as summer gave way to autumn.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My phone rang as summer gave way to autumn.

auth_sentence.content: Bet you a tenner they're famous by autumn.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bet you a tenner they're famous by autumn.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bet you a tenner they're famous by autumn.

sentences.en: The fall of one leaf is enough to tell coming of autumn.
Nature is most colourful in autumn.
sentences.cn: 秋天, 大自然的色彩最为丰富。

sentences.en: What I like best is the autumn in Beijing.
sentences.cn: 我最喜欢的是北京的秋天。

sentences.en: On a lovely autumn evening we went out on a picnic.
sentences.cn: 在一个美好的秋夜, 我们外出野餐。

sentences.en: He came to see us last autumn.
He has entered the serene autumn of his life.
sentences.cn: 他已进入了美好的中年时期。

jushi.english: Autumn colours are the browns, oranges and yellows of autumn leaves.
jushi.chinese: 秋季的色彩就是落叶的褐色、橙色和黄色。

jushi.english: On a lovely autumn evening we went out on a picnic.
jushi.chinese: 在一个美好的秋夜,我们外出野餐。

jushi.english: She went to Germany in the autumn of 1996.
